title: "Ekko is a skirmishing assassin who 'lacks the raw power to burst his targets down"

The words "assassins" & "burst" & "DON'T" doesn't work in the same sentence.

ASSASSINS like to BURST down enemies, so DON'T approach them.

 There, it works.

Point is:
Calling something an assassin then going on to say it lacks burst is questionable when you consider the job of an assassin.An assassin needs burst to do it's job or else it's a fighter or mage.

The sad part is that when Riot made good on what they said about Fizz by shifting his design to be "more damage by staying in your face rather than upfront burst" he was declared broken then, too. I'm thinking people just don't like Fizz regardless of what Riot does or says about him. His mobility at least made sense in the context of a fighter, what with his entire kit looking like it was outright designed for high mobility and being in their face fairly often.

That said, before he was turned back into a burst assassin, he could have used his numbers toned down a little and I think most people would've been fine with him. Other than, y'know, people that just plain hate Fizz' existence in the first place. But they're going to hate him no matter what, so it's not like you need to base anything around their opinion, just like no one should base any ideas about Kalista on my opinion of her. My idea being outright deletion.

You're right.

Here's my reasoning behind agreeing:

Fizz can be untargettable 3 times in a span of six seconds (two Es + hourglass).  On top of having a dash that doesn't *stop* at the opponent but instead passes right through them, allowing him to use an enemy/minion/etc as an object to propel himself away from danger if they're right on top of him.

You basically have to wait for him to use his full combo + hourglass + use another one or two abilities, before you can retaliate.  That 'slippery' style can be very frustrating to play against.

The whole concept of an assassin without burst damage eludes me.  "non-burst" and "assassin" just don't combine, since assassins require burst to assassinate high-priority targets.  The idea of an "assassin" in league of legends was to go in, kill a high priority target (such as ADC, other AP carry, or support.) then get out.  Either the title "assassin" or the "non-burst damage" must be dropped from the idea for it to make any sense.

How could a non-burst "assassin" work?  Isn't it just a mage or bruiser at that point, like Ryze, Brand or Darius?

How about a champion with a lot of mobility who depends on making several passes in order to kill someone.  IE someone who comes in, does their damage putting you around 60% HP and then got out, and then they come back putting you at 20% HP and then got out, and then come back and kill you, and then got out.

Maybe not exact numbers but you know how about an assassin that gives you a chance to make strategic decisions instead of one who just appears, kills you before you can respond and is instantly gone spamming /laugh.

Having crazy mobility should cost you damage as it should be a requirement that you USE that mobility to get into and out of fights over the course of a long fight to kill your target, not that you get to instantly delete people while coming and going as you please.
